intro: Biscutella cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Biscutella cuneata is often found in meadows, slopes, and open woodlands at high elevations.
